rComments: Work hard, and you'll get an A+. She's always available for her students and explains all concepts pretty well. This class is challenging, but you'll learn a lot from it!

This professor is a nice person. However, she really makes you WORK for that A+. Some advice: listen very carefully to her lectures (write down each word), watch all the asynchronous content, read the book and write notes! The material is easy, but the way she explains makes it hard. She gives no instructions, so the TAs will really be your BFFS.

This was my 2nd class w/Professor Marcoux, hss 2521 and this one both courses were awful. Long dry readings every week and lots of work outside of class for the asynchronous weeks. We had 1 midterm a project and a final. The first midterm was open book and it was not great but not terrible, the project was confusing and the final was just as bad.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Worst prof in HSS by far. Avoid at all costs. She really expects you to invest 10 hours in her course every week. On top of this, she holds students to a super high standard but can't follow through with grading on a timeline that she established herself.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: LA PIRE PROF DANS HSS OU MEME DANS L'UNIVERSITÉ. Éviter la à tout pris!
This is the worst class I've taken in my undergrad so far. Disorganized, stressful and an insane amount of work. Avoid at all costs.

This was one of the worst classes I've taken. The prof gives an unreasonable amount of extra work every week. The exams are ridiculously hard, and it's difficult to know how to study since there is so much material. Her lectures are hard to watch and the slides have little information. Do not take this class!

Prof. Marcoux est une des pires profs de HSS. Elle nous donne énormément de travail, jusqu'à 10-11h de travaux en dehors de la salle de classe. Pour l'examen final, elle a decide à la dernière minute que l'examen sera finalement pas livre ouvert sans changer le type de questions. Elle m'a dit qu'une moyenne de C+ est trop élevée pour son cours :(

The most stingy prof I've ever met. Not only does she assigne at least 7HOURS of extra material per week but won't round up your 89.87 grade to a 90. I've done more work for this class that any of my mandatory biology/anatomy classes. I for one liked the material and was interested in learning but she had to ruin that. AVOID

AVOID AVOID AVOID. The worst prof experience ever. She does not know her material, she is condescending when students ask questions, and NEVER gives you a straight answer. Her asynchronous material is absurd and gives no direction towards exams or projects. She has caused my friends and I multiple nervous breakdowns.

She rarely gives any examples for very subjective theories and concepts. She rarely answers questions clearly, her class material is all over the place. There is not much on her slides at all, insanely hard to listen to. When we inquire about information she tends to be rude and unhelpful.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Test heavy', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: The prof doesn't seem to be comfortable with the material she is teaching. This is a very frustrating and stressful class.

This class was a hybrid class for the first time, and I hope the last for the sake of future students. the workload assigned for the online portion was ridiculous. I spent more time working on an elective than on mandatory HSS courses. unrealistic expectations for full-time students with 5 courses. will NEVER take a class with her again.....
one of the worst classes I have ever taken in university, and i am an A student, one of my worst marks. AVOID at all costs

I am a 4th year student taking a 2nd year class! Her class is hybrid, most weeks classes are online. UNLIKE most online classes, there is a ridiculous amount of work assigned to every online class. I easily spend 10h/week reading the book and answering questions she assigned. Ive never taken an HSS elective with so much work. Take ANY other electiv

She has ridiculous expectations from her students and her teaching needs to improve. She is very slow and seems to not know her subject that well. Her explanations don't make sense and she contradicts herself very often, sometimes within the same sentence. Never taking a class with her again, I recommend you avoid her if possible.

She is a very good teacher. He power points are very well structured and her tests are multiple choice. If you memorize easily this will be a great class for you. I recommend taking this as an elective because it is not a hard class. The group project is a bit of work so pick good teammates.
Great prof she will make you work for a good grade, but if you try hard you will do great. She gives good lectured and really knows her material.

Very nice prof, but will absolutely destroy you in assessments. If you skip her classes, get ready to do a lot of extra readings because her powerpoints aren't always clear. Night classes always end in half of the time, but she packs in A LOT of information.  Watch the videos she assigns because they ARE important.
NICE
WORST PROF IN HSS!!!!
Never taking a class with Marcoux again. Has ridiculous expectations from her students and tests material that she never taught in class and never assigned in the readings.
